title: Plastic-Eating Worms Could Be The Solution To Faster Reduction Of Pollution
content: A plastic-eating insect may help solve the trash problem that has choked the Earth for a long time, scientists have concluded in a new study.
summary: A plastic-eating insect may help solve the trash problem that has choked the Earth for a long time, scientists have concluded in a new study.

title: "Miscarriage Of Justice": Donald Trump Slams Joe Biden For Pardoning Son
content: Outgoing US President Joe Biden has pardoned his son Hunter Biden, who had been convicted on charges related to gun crimes and tax violations.
summary: Outgoing US President Joe Biden has pardoned his son Hunter Biden, who had been convicted on charges related to gun crimes and tax violations.

title: Indian-American Kash Patel, FBI Chief In Trump 2.0, Joins X, Elon Musk Reacts
content: Indian-American Kashyap "Kash" Patel has been nominated as the FBI director by US President-elect Donald Trump.
summary: Indian-American Kashyap "Kash" Patel has been nominated as the FBI director by US President-elect Donald Trump.

title: Gaza, Ukraine Wars, Regional Tensions Boosting Arms Sales: Report
content: Sales by major arms makers were boosted last year by wars in Ukraine and Gaza and tensions in Asia, with marked increases for manufacturers based in Russia and the Middle East.
summary: Sales by major arms makers were boosted last year by wars in Ukraine and Gaza and tensions in Asia, with marked increases for manufacturers based in Russia and the Middle East.

title: Woman Looking For Her Birth Parents Finds Father In Facebook Friends List
content: Tamuna Museridze had been looking for her birth parents since 2016 but only made the breakthrough earlier this year.
summary: Tamuna Museridze had been looking for her birth parents since 2016 but only made the breakthrough earlier this year.

title: Trudeau Promises Trump 'Tougher Border Controls' During Florida Meet
content: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau promised President-elect Donald Trump that Canada would toughen controls over the long undefended joint border, a senior Canadian official said.
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau promised President-elect Donald Trump that Canada would toughen controls over the long undefended joint border, a senior Canadian official said.

title: Bob Bryar, Former My Chemical Romance Drummer, Dies At Age 44
content: Law enforcement sources indicated that all his belongings, including weapons and music equipment, remained undisturbed, further ruling out foul play.
summary: Law enforcement sources indicated that all his belongings, including weapons and music equipment, remained undisturbed, further ruling out foul play.

title: Deadliest Month For Security Forces In Pakistan, 68 Die In Terror Attacks
content: At least 257 people, including 104 security personnel and 119 civilians, were injured in clashes and bombings in Pakistan in November.
summary: At least 257 people, including 104 security personnel and 119 civilians, were injured in clashes and bombings in Pakistan in November.

title: Over 100 Killed Amid Clashes Between Fans At Football Match In Guinea
content: Dozens of people were killed Sunday in clashes between fans at a football match in N'Zerekore, Guinea's second largest city.
summary: Dozens of people were killed Sunday in clashes between fans at a football match in N'Zerekore, Guinea's second largest city.

title: Norway Halts Plans To Conduct Deep-Sea Mining
content: Norway will not proceed with plans to conduct deep-sea mining, the SV party which supports the minority centre-left government said on Sunday.
summary: Norway will not proceed with plans to conduct deep-sea mining, the SV party which supports the minority centre-left government said on Sunday.

title: Man Allegedly Kills 'Sneezing' Roommate After He Came 'Close' To Dinner
content: Richard Lombardi and Frank Griswold had been friends since the early 1990s when they worked together at a company.
summary: Richard Lombardi and Frank Griswold had been friends since the early 1990s when they worked together at a company.

title: "Hunter Was Singled Out": Joe Biden Pardons Son In 2 Criminal Cases
content: US President Joe Biden on Sunday said he had issued an official pardon for his son Hunter, who is facing sentencing for two criminal cases.
summary: US President Joe Biden on Sunday said he had issued an official pardon for his son Hunter, who is facing sentencing for two criminal cases.

title: Trump Names Lebanese-American Massad Boulos As Middle-East Advisor
content: US President-elect Donald Trump on Sunday named Lebanese-American businessman Massad Boulos as his senior advisor on Arab and Middle Eastern affairs, the latest family member to be appointed to a key position.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump on Sunday named Lebanese-American businessman Massad Boulos as his senior advisor on Arab and Middle Eastern affairs, the latest family member to be appointed to a key position.

title: Zelensky Seeks NATO Security Guarantees, Weapons Before Russia Talks
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Sunday that his country needed security guarantees from NATO and more weapons to defend itself before any talks with Russia.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Sunday that his country needed security guarantees from NATO and more weapons to defend itself before any talks with Russia.

title: US Rules Out Returning Nuclear Weapons To Ukraine, Says Jake Sullivan
content: The United States is not considering returning to Ukraine the nuclear weapons it gave up after the Soviet Union collapsed, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said on Sunday.
summary: The United States is not considering returning to Ukraine the nuclear weapons it gave up after the Soviet Union collapsed, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said on Sunday.

title: Gaza Ceasefire And Hostage Deal  "Not There Yet", Says White House
content: The White House is working on a ceasefire and hostage release deal in Gaza but is "not there yet," the US National Security Advisor told NBC on Sunday, with fighting in the conflict raging on as regional leaders meet to discuss the crisis.
summary: The White House is working on a ceasefire and hostage release deal in Gaza but is "not there yet," the US National Security Advisor told NBC on Sunday, with fighting in the conflict raging on as regional leaders meet to discuss the crisis.

title: Bangladesh Court Acquits All In 2004 Attack On Sheikh Hasina's Rally Case
content: Bengaldesh High Court on Sunday acquitted all accused, including former Bangladesh prime minister Khaleda Zia's son Tarique Rahman and former state minister Lutfozzaman Babar, in a 2004 grenade attack in ousted premier Sheikh Hasina's rally.
summary: Bengaldesh High Court on Sunday acquitted all accused, including former Bangladesh prime minister Khaleda Zia's son Tarique Rahman and former state minister Lutfozzaman Babar, in a 2004 grenade attack in ousted premier Sheikh Hasina's rally.

title: British Man Dies In Lift Shaft During Holiday In Turkey, Family Seeks Probe
content: His family is devastated and seeking a thorough investigation into the circumstances of his death, which remain unclear.
summary: His family is devastated and seeking a thorough investigation into the circumstances of his death, which remain unclear.

title: Georgian PM Praises Police For Crackdown Of Protests Over Halt Of EU Talks
content: Facing condemnation from the United States and defiance from his own president, Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze praised police on Sunday for cracking down on protesters who he said were acting on foreign orders to undermine the state.
summary: Facing condemnation from the United States and defiance from his own president, Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze praised police on Sunday for cracking down on protesters who he said were acting on foreign orders to undermine the state.

title: Japan To Prosecute Dead Teen Whose Suicide Attempt Killed A Woman
content: Many argued that pursuing charges against the dead teenager is unnecessary and a misallocation of resources, as it serves no practical purpose.
summary: Many argued that pursuing charges against the dead teenager is unnecessary and a misallocation of resources, as it serves no practical purpose.
